reason: Bitcoin's rebound to $76,000 is explicitly noted as potentially temporary, indicating weak upward momentum. Prominent analysts are issuing severe warnings of a 'death spiral' and significant liquidations across broader markets impacting crypto, suggesting strong downside risk. Large institutional paper losses further underscore market fragility. While long-term institutional adoption is positive, immediate signals point to a period of distribution and high market instability.
headlines: Ether and majors rise as bitcoin rebounds to $76,000 but the bounce may not last
Crypto darknet drug kingpin Rui-Siang Lin gets 30 years
'Big Short' Michael Burry flags “death spiral” after silver liquidations beat bitcoin
